SNA Descritive Analysis from "Projeto Redes de Atenção às pessoas que consomem álcool e outras Drogas em Juiz de Fora-MG   Brazil"  - SNArRDJF

Here you can find a basic script to analysis data from SNArRDJF - this script was elaborated considering its use for orther matrix adjacency data from SNArRDJF - Here we are going to analyse:

# 23_CONFIANÇA F) Confia em realizar ações conjuntas com este serviço (var21).

`#########################

#Edges Newman-Girvan Edge-Betweenness - Non-Weighted
Edge betweenness Edge betweenness is equal to the number of shortest paths σst(e) from all vertices to all others that pass through that edge e
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Edge Betweenness
E(var21)$edge.betweenness_n<-edge.betweenness(var21, weights =E(var21)$equalone)
var21_edge.betweenness_n <-edge.betweenness(var21, weights =E(var21)$equalone)
```
#Edge Betweenness Descriptive
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
summary(var21_edge.betweenness_n)
sd(var21_edge.betweenness_n)
```

#Edges Newman-Girvan Edge-Betweenness - Weighted
Edge betweenness Edge betweenness is equal to the number of shortest paths σst(e) from all vertices to all others that pass through that edge e
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Edge Betweenness
E(var21)$edge.betweenness<-edge.betweenness(var21, weights =E(var21)$var21)
var21_edge.betweenness <-edge.betweenness(var21, weights =E(var21)$var21)
```
#Edge Betweenness Descriptive
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
summary(var21_edge.betweenness)
sd(var21_edge.betweenness)
```

#Betweenness Edge Dinamic Table
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Betweenness Measures Dinamic Table
#Getting  Measures
var21_edge.betweenness_n <-edge.betweenness(var21, weights =E(var21)$equalone)
var21_edge.betweenness <-edge.betweenness(var21, weights =E(var21)$var21)

#Creating a dataframe of measures
var21_df_betweenness <- data.frame(var21_edge.betweenness_n ,
var21_edge.betweenness) %>% round(1)

labels<-attr(E(var21), "vnames")
#edgebt<-cbind(round(var21_edge.betweenness,2),labels)

#Adding type
var21_df_betweenness <-cbind(var21_df_betweenness, labels)

#Adding names
names(var21_df_betweenness) <- c("Edge Betweenness", "Edge Betweenness Weighted", "Type")

#Ordering Variables
var21_df_betweenness<-var21_df_betweenness[c("Type","Edge Betweenness", "Edge Betweenness Weighted")]
```
## General tabel for Betweenness
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
datatable(var21_df_betweenness, filter = 'top')
```
##Aggregating data from previous table - mean
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
aggdata_mean <-aggregate(var21_df_betweenness, by=list(var21_df_betweenness$Type), FUN=mean, na.rm=TRUE)

names(aggdata_mean) <- c("Group","Type","Betweenness(M)", "Betweenness Weighted(M)")
  
#Removing Type variable
aggdata_mean<-aggdata_mean[,-c(2)]
```
##Aggregating data from previous table - sd
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
aggdata_sd <-aggregate(var21_df_betweenness, by=list(var21_df_betweenness$Type), FUN=sd, na.rm=TRUE) 

names(aggdata_sd) <- c("Group","Type","Betweenness(SD)", "Betweenness Weighted(SD)")

#Removing Type variable
aggdata_sd<-aggdata_sd[,-c(2)]
```
##Merging mean and standart deviation
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
total_table<- merge(aggdata_mean,aggdata_sd,by="Group")

#Rounding
Group<-total_table[,c(1)] #Keeping group
total_table<-total_table[,-c(1)] %>% round(1) #Rouding
total_table<-cbind(Group,total_table) #Binding toghter

#Organizing Variabels
total_table<-total_table[c("Group","Betweenness(M)","Betweenness(SD)","Betweenness Weighted(M)", "Betweenness Weighted(SD)")]
```
##Plotting final table with round
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
datatable(total_table, filter = 'top')
```

#Network plotting based only on degree measures 
```{r, echo=TRUE, fig.height=12, fig.width=12, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Set Seed
set.seed(123)
#Plotting based only on degree measures 
edge.start <- ends(var21, es=E(var21), names=F)[,1]

# Fixing ego
minC <- rep(-Inf, vcount(var21))
maxC <- rep(Inf, vcount(var21))
minC[1] <- maxC[1] <- 0
co <- layout_with_fr(var21, niter=10000, minx=minC, maxx=maxC,miny=minC, maxy=maxC, weights =E(var21)$edge.betweenness)

min(E(var21)$edge.betweenness)
#PLotting
plot(var21, 
     layout=co,
     edge.color=V(var21)$color[edge.start],
     edge.arrow.size=E(var21)$edge.betweenness/10000*mean(E(var21)$edge.betweenness+1),
     edge.width=E(var21)$var21/10*mean((E(var21)$var21+1)),
     edge.curved = TRUE,
     vertex.size=log((degree(var21)+2))*(0.5*mean(degree(var21))),
     vertex.frame.color="#ffffff",
     vertex.label.color="black",
     vertex.label=get.vertex.attribute(var21,"LABEL_COR"),
     vertex.label.cex=log(degree(var21)+2)/mean(degree(var21)),
     vertex.label.dist=0,
     rescale=F,
     xlim=range(co[,1]), 
     ylim=range(co[,2]))
axis(1)
axis(2)


#Solving Problems with legend rendering 
a<-V(var21)$LABEL_COR
b<-V(var21)$color
c<-table(a,b)
d<-as.data.frame(c)
e<-subset(d, d$Freq>0)
f<-t(e$a)
g<-t(e$b)

#Adding Legend
legend(x=range(co[,1])[2], y=range(co[,2])[2],
       legend=as.character(f),
       pch=21,
       col = "#777777", 
       pt.bg=as.character(g),
       pt.cex=2,
       bty="n", 
       ncol=1,
       lty=1,
       cex = .5)

#Adding Title
  title("Network Edge Betweenness Sized - 23_CONFIANÇA F) Confia em realizar ações conjuntas com este serviço (var21).", sub = "Source: from authors ", cex = .5)
  text(x=range(co[,1])[1], y=range(co[,2])[1], labels = 
   sprintf("Mean Betweenness : %.2f\n SD Betweenness : %.2f",
     mean(E(var21)$edge.betweenness), 
     sd(E(var21)$edge.betweenness)
   ))
```
